Astle * Matt Ember}} | based on = {{based on|''[[The True Meaning of Smekday]]''|[[Adam Rex]]}} | starring = {{plain list| * [[Jim Parsons]] * [[Rihanna]] * [[Steve Martin]] * [[Jennifer Lopez]] * [[Matt L. Jones|Matt Jones]]}} | music = [[Lorne Balfe]]{{cite news|title=Lorne Balfe Scoring DreamWorks Animation’s ‘Home’|url=http://filmmusicreporter.com/2014/11/24/lorne-balfe-scoring-dreamworks-animations-home/|accessdate=January 7, 2015|newspaper=Film Music Reporter|date=November 24, 2014}}
[[Stargate (production team)|Stargate]] | editing = [[Nick Fletcher]] | studio = [[DreamWorks Animation]] | distributor = [[20th Century Fox]] | released = {{Film date|2015|03|7|[[Boulder International Film Festival|BIFF]]|2015|03|27|United States}} | runtime = 94 minutes{{cite web | url=http://www.bbfc.co.uk/releases/home-film-1 | title=''HOME'' [2D] (U) | work=[[British Board of Film Classification]] | date=February 18, 2015 | accessdate=February 18, 2015}} | country = United States | language = English | budget = $135 million{{cite web|title=Home (2015)|url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/movies/?id=happysmekday.htm|website=''[[Box Office Mojo]]''|publisher=[[Amazon.com]]|accessdate=October 10, 2015}} | gross = $386 million }} '''''Home''''' is a 2015 American [[3D film|3D]] [[Computer-animated film|computer-animated]] [[Science fiction film|science fiction]] [[Comedy film|comedy]]-[[Adventure film|adventure]] [[buddy film]]{{cite web|last1=Spangler|first1=Todd|title=Netflix Orders ‘Home’ Alien-Buddy Comedy TV Series From DreamWorks Animation|url=https://variety.com/2016/digital/news/netflix-home-series-dreamworks-animation-1201743080/|accessdate=22 August 2016|date=31 March 2016}}{{cite news|title=DreamWorks Animation SKG Management Discusses Q3 2013 Results - Earnings Call Transcript|url=http://seekingalpha.com/article/1785052-dreamworks-animation-skg-management-discusses-q3-2013-results-earnings-call-transcript?part=single|accessdate=October 30, 2013|newspaper=Seeking Alpha|date=October 29, 2013|quote=Home is an outrageously funny buddy movie about a hilarious, yet inept, alien race and their equally inept invasion of Earth.}} produced by [[DreamWorks Animation]] and distributed by [[20th Century Fox]]. It is loosely based on [[Adam Rex]]'s 2007 children's book ''[[The True Meaning of Smekday]]'' and stars the voices of [[Jim Parsons]], [[Rihanna]], [[Steve Martin]], [[Jennifer Lopez]], and [[Matt L. Jones|Matt Jones]]. [[Tim Johnson (film director)|Tim Johnson]] is the director of the film, [[Chris Jenkins (film producer)|Chris Jenkins]] and Suzanne Buirgy are its producers, and the screenplay is by Tom J. Astle and Matt Ember. The story takes place on planet [[Earth]], where an alien race called the Boov invade the planet. However, a girl named Tip Tucci manages to avoid capture, and goes on the run with Oh, a fugitive Boov. The film was released in theaters on March 27, 2015. ''Home'' was promoted with the release of a four-minute short film titled ''Almost Home'', which was shown in theaters before DreamWorks Animation's ''[[Mr. Peabody & Sherman]]'' and [[Blue Sky Studios]]' ''[[Rio 2]]'' in 2014. It premiered at the [[Boulder International Film Festival]] on March 7, 2015. Besides lending her voice to the film, Rihanna also created a concept album [[Home (soundtrack)|of the same name]]. The soundtrack includes guest vocals from Jennifer Lopez, among others, was supported by two singles, "[[Towards the Sun (song)|Towards the Sun]]" and "[[Feel the Light]]". ''Home'' received mixed reviews from critics and grossed $386 million worldwide. A [[Home: Adventures with Tip & Oh|Netflix original series]] was released on July 29, 2016 that takes place after the events of the film and uses hand-drawn animation and none of the original cast (except Matt Jones) reprised their roles. ==Plot== On the run from their enemy, the so-called planet-destroying Gorg, an alien race known as the Boov find [[Earth]] a suitable place to call "home". Led by Captain Smek ([[Steve Martin]]), they commence their "friendly" invasion of the planet, relocating the humans, whom the Boov deem as simple and backwards, to other parts of the planet while the Boov inhabit their homes in a quick and [[Bloodless war|bloodless conquest]]. One of the Boov, named Oh ([[Jim Parsons]]), is a more excitable, freethinking member of the species, who decides to invite the Boov to his apartment for a housewarming party, despite the race's [[antipathy]] towards him. Not far from Oh is a fourteen year old{{cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2015/03/27/home-tim-johnson_n_6951448.html|title='Home' Director Tim Johnson On The Film's Immigrant Theme And Animating 'Realistic' Bodies|date=March 27, 2015|work=The Huffington Post}} girl named Tip Tucci ([[Rihanna]]), who drives away through her home city to find her mother Lucy ([[Jennifer Lopez]]) after being separated from her during the invasion, leaving her with only her [[calico cat]] Pig and fueling her hatred for the Boov. Oh runs into the street to meet up with a Boov cop named Kyle ([[Matt L. Jones|Matt Jones]]), who, like the rest of the Boov, doesn't want to befriend him. Oh invites him to the party but accidentally sends a mass invite to every Boov on Earth. However, the "send all" button he pressed actually sends the invite to absolutely every alien race in the entire universe including the Gorg. Everyone, aggravated with Oh for revealing their location to the enemy, starts chasing him down. Oh runs into a convenience store to hide just as Tip and Pig enter the same store to grab supplies. They come across each other, and after Tip's car fails to start, Oh transforms it into a fantastical, hovering craft named Slushious to continue transportation. Oh hitches a ride with Tip when he promises to help her find Lucy, but unfortunately, they must go to the Boov Command Center in [[Paris]] and locate her from there. After reaching the Boov Command Center, which is in the now-floating [[Eiffel Tower]], Oh manages to get into his account, and deletes the message with just a second to spare before it reaches the Gorg. He then plugs in Tip's brain to help her find Lucy. They eventually trace her location to [[Australia]], where she is also looking for her daughter. The other Boov then find the two and try to "erase" Oh, while Tip grabs the gravity manipulation system and flips it over, causing the whole Tower to tilt upside down, hence the two manage to escape. As Oh and Tip head off to Australia, they are ambushed by other Boov riding by them in fear, and realize that a Gorg ship is close behind them. Tip and Oh manage to knock it down, but in the process a chunk of it hits them and they lose their slushie fuel, causing the car to crash-land. They come across the fallen Gorg ship and find out that it is actually a drone. Oh recovers a special chip and uses it to get their car up and running. Tip and Oh make it to Australia and see the Boov evacuating to their mothership. When they land the car, Tip immediately starts looking for her mother, but Oh insists on evacuating with the other Boov instead. Tip gets upset at him for trying to break their promise again, and she declares that he was never truly her friend. The depressed Oh returns to the ship. The Gorg mothership comes close to the Boov ship, but Oh pulls out the Gorg chip and uses it to fly the ship further away from the Gorg. The Boov become astonished at Oh's bravery, but Smek becomes upset and reminds everyone that he is the captain. However, Oh stands up to Smek, telling him that he's a terrible captain and tells the Boov about what he learned from Tip about humans caring for other people while the Boov barely even care for each other. Saddened by this revelation at first, the Boovs then [[mutiny]] against Smek and Kyle grabs Smek's "Shusher" (a scepter with a rock on top of it, which Smek stole from the Gorg in a meeting) and gives it to Oh, declaring him the new captain, much to Smek's dismay. Tip rushes aimlessly around the city to find Lucy, but in vain. Oh returns to her side and helps her track down Lucy. The mother and daughter finally reunite and thank Oh. Suddenly, the Gorg mothership descends upon the planet, and Oh realizes that they want the rock on the Shusher, since Smek had previously stolen it from them. Oh runs to the ship to try to attract its attention, locking Tip and Lucy in the car for safety. Tip breaks out of the car and shines a light in the Gorg Commander ([[Brian Stepanek]])'s face to bring his attention to Oh as he holds the rock up. The Gorg Commander halts the ship as it crunches down on the ground, with Oh directly in its path. Tip rushes to rescue him, but Oh is seemingly crushed beneath the ship until it backs up and reveals him uninjured. The Gorg Commander emerges from his armor to show that he is actually a harmless [[starfish]]-like creature. Oh returns the rock to him, which turns out to be an egg for millions of developing Gorg larvae; the next generation of Gorg, revealing that the Gorg Commander/"Father" had been the [[Endling|last of his kind]], alone and almost [[extinct]]. He thanks Oh and departs. Two weeks later, the humans have returned to their original homes, and Oh finally gets to have his party at his apartment, with both humans and Boov in attendance. Tip plays her music and gets the rest of the Boov to experience dancing for the first time, while other Boov, including a reformed Smek, party on the moon, and thousands of ships from other planets, including the Gorg and his babies, head to Earth for Oh's party upon receiving his invite. ==Voice cast== *[[Jim Parsons]] as Oh, a Boov fugitive.{{cite news|title=Intergalactic Memo - Subject: Steve Martin and Jennifer Lopez|url=http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/intergalactic-memo-226477781.html|accessdate=October 4, 2013|newspaper=PR Newswire|date=October 4, 2013}} *[[Rihanna]] as Tip Tucci, a teenage girl who befriends Oh.{{cite web|title=Home - Characters|url=http://www.dreamworks.com/home/|publisher=DreamWorks Animation|accessdate=November 29, 2014}} *[[Steve Martin]] as Captain Smek, the fearful, selfish leader of the Boov race. *[[Jennifer Lopez]] as Lucy Tucci, Tip's caring mother.{{cite web|last=Dickey|first=Josh|title=Jennifer Lopez, Steve Martin Board DreamWorks Animation’s ‘Home’ (Exclusive)|url=http://www.thewrap.com/steve-martin-jennifer-lopez-board-dreamworks-animations-home-exclusive/|publisher=The Wrap News Inc|accessdate=October 4, 2013|date=October 3, 2013}} *[[Matt L. Jones|Matt Jones]] as Kyle, a Boov [[police officer]]. *[[Brian Stepanek]] as Gorg Commander, the frightful-but-caring leader and father of the Gorg race's last children. **Stepanek also voices some Boov. *April Lawrence as Boov Announcer. *Nigel W. Tierney as Child A. The rest of the Boov were voiced by Stephen Kearin, Lisa Stewart and [[April Winchell]]. ==Production== [[File:Barack Obama, Steve Martin, Jim Parsons, DreamWorks Animation, 2013.jpg|thumb|United States president [[Barack Obama]] visited DreamWorks Animation in November 2013, where he met with [[Steve Martin]] and [[Jim Parsons]], who were recording lines for the film.{{cite news|last=Johnson|first=Ted|title=Obama Tours DreamWorks Animation, Visits With Steve Martin and Jim Parsons|url=https://variety.com/2013/film/news/obama-tours-dreamworks-animation-visits-with-steve-martin-and-jim-parsons-1200887780/|accessdate=February 8, 2014|newspaper=Variety|date=November 26, 2013}}]] In 2008, [[DreamWorks Animation]] optioned the book's rights to adapt it into an animated feature film. On his blog, Adam Rex announced that DreamWorks renewed the option of the adaptation in 2011.{{cite news|last=Herreras|first=Mari|title=T Q&A Adam Rex|url=http://www.tucsonweekly.com/tucson/t-qanda/Content?oid=2219158|accessdate=February 2, 2012|newspaper=Tucson Weekly|date=September 23, 2010}}{{cite web|last=Rex|first=Adam|title=@delzey Yes, Dreamworks optioned SMEKDAY 3 yrs. ago, and renewed the option this year. If they make it I expect it'll be CGI. #kidlitchat|url=https://www.twitter.com/MrAdamRex/statuses/136632623945629700|work=MrAdamRex|publisher=Twitter|accessdate=February 2, 2012|date=November 16, 2011}} On June 20, 2012, it was revealed that the title of the film would be ''Happy Smekday!'', [[Jim Parsons]] and [[Rihanna]] would star in the lead roles, and the film would be released in the fourth quarter of 2014.{{cite web|title=Jim Parsons and Rihanna to Voice DreamWorks Animation's Happy Smekday!|url=http://www.comingsoon.net/news/movienews.php?id=91699|work=DreamWorks Animation|publisher=ComingSoon.net|accessdate=June 20, 2012|date=June 20, 2012}} In September 2012, [[20th Century Fox]] and DreamWorks Animation announced a release date of November 26, 2014.{{cite news|title=New Distributor Twentieth Century Fox Unveils DreamWorks Animation's Release Slate Through 2016 |url=http://ir.dreamworksanimation.com/releasedetail.cfm?ReleaseID=705761 |accessdate=September 10, 2012 |newspaper=DreamWorks Animation |date=September 9, 2012 |author=DreamWorks Animation |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20131012035253/http://ir.dreamworksanimation.com/releasedetail.cfm?ReleaseID=705761 |archivedate=October 12, 2013 |df=mdy-all }} In June 2013, the film was retitled from ''Happy Smekday!'' to ''Home''.{{cite web|title=Movie Title Changes|url=http://boxofficemojo.com/schedule/?view=titlechanges&p=.htm|publisher=Box Office Mojo|accessdate=June 16, 2013}} On October 3, 2013, it was announced that [[Steve Martin]] and [[Jennifer Lopez]] had joined the cast. On May 20, 2014, the film's release date was pushed back to March 27, 2015, switching places with DreamWorks Animation's film ''[[Penguins of Madagascar]]''.{{cite web|url=http://www.deadline.com/2014/05/the-penguins-of-madagascar-release-date-home-dreamworks-animation/ |title=DreamWorks Animation Moves Up 'Penguins Of Madagascar' Bow, Bumps 'Home' To 2015 |website=Deadline Hollywood |date=May 20, 2014 |accessdate=May 20, 2014}} [[Jeffrey Katzenberg]], DreamWorks Animation's CEO, reasoned that ''Penguins'', coming from one of DWA's most successful franchises, would more easily stand out during [[Thanksgiving]] time, while ''Home'' would try to take advantage of the less competitive spring release window, and repeat successful spring launches of some of DWA's original films, including ''[[The Croods]]'' and ''[[How to Train Your Dragon (film)|How to Train Your Dragon]]''.{{cite web|title=DreamWorks Animation SKG's (DWA) CEO Jeffrey Katzenberg on Q2 2014 Results - Earnings Call Transcript|url=http://seekingalpha.com/article/2355535-dreamworks-animation-skgs-dwa-ceo-jeffrey-katzenberg-on-q2-2014-results-earnings-call-transcript?part=single|publisher=Seeking Alpha|accessdate=July 30, 2014|date=July 29, 2014}} ==Soundtrack== {{main|Home (soundtrack)}} In addition to her voice role, [[Rihanna]] created a [[concept album]] for the film (also titled ''[[Home (soundtrack)|Home]]'') which was released on March 24, 2015.{{cite news|last=Graser|first=Marc|title=Rihanna to Make Concept Album for Upcoming Animated Movie|url=https://variety.com/2014/film/news/rihanna-to-make-concept-album-for-dreamworks-animations-home-1201120819/|accessdate=February 26, 2014|newspaper=Variety|date=February 25, 2014}}{{cite web|title=DreamWorks Animation SKG Management Discusses Q3 2013 Results - Earnings Call Transcript|url=http://seekingalpha.com/article/1785052-dreamworks-animation-skg-management-discusses-q3-2013-results-earnings-call-transcript?part=single|publisher=Seeking Alpha|accessdate=February 26, 2014|date=October 29, 2013|quote=Together with her world-class songwriting creative team, Rihanna has been collaborating with us for over the last 2 years to create an innovative musical movie event that features an entire concept album of brand-new songs and we couldn't be more excited about it.}} It consists of 8 original songs.{{cite web|last=Ellwood|first=Gregory|title=Jeffery Katzenberg|url=http://www.hitfix.com/in-contention/jeffrey-katzenberg-on-dragon-sequels-and-how-marvel-is-dreamworks-new-competition|publisher=''HitFix''|accessdate=May 30, 2014|date=May 21, 2014}} The soundtrack's lead single, Rihanna's "[[Towards the Sun (song)|Towards the Sun]]", premiered on [[BBC Radio 1]] on February 24, 2015,{{cite web|last=Trendell|first=Andrew|title=Rihanna Returns with New Single 'Towards The Sun'|url=http://www.gigwise.com/videos/98363/rihanna-towards-the-sun-new-single-unveiled---listen|publisher=''Giwise''|accessdate=March 3, 2015|date=February 24, 2015}} and was made available for [[music download|digital download]] the same day, via the [[iTunes Store]].{{cite web|title=Towards the Sun (From The "Home" Soundtrack) - Single |url=https://itunes.apple.com/ca/album/towards-sun-from-home-soundtrack/id970475425 |publisher=''iTunes'' |accessdate=March 3, 2015 |date=February 24, 2015 }}{{dead link|date=April 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} The second single, "[[Feel the Light]]", recorded by Jennifer Lopez, was released on February 25, 2015 via the [[iTunes Store]].{{cite web|title=Feel the Light (From The "Home" Soundtrack) - Single|url=https://itunes.apple.com/au/album/feel-light-from-home-soundtrack/id971195229|publisher=''iTunes''|accessdate=March 3, 2015|date=February 25, 2015}} ==Release== A 4-minute short film called ''Almost Home'' was attached to theatrical showings of DreamWorks Animation's ''[[Mr. Peabody & Sherman]]'' in early 2014{{cite web|last=Amidi|first=Amid|title=DreamWorks Promotes Upcoming ‘Home’ with New Short ‘Almost Home’|url=http://www.cartoonbrew.com/feature-film/dreamworks-promotes-upcoming-home-with-new-short-almost-home-97014.html|publisher=Cartoon Brew|accessdate=March 10, 2014|date=March 10, 2014}} and Blue Sky Studios' ''[[Rio 2]]'' that same year.{{cite web|url=http://cumberlink.com/news/opinion/blogs/now_showing/movie-blog-review-rio/article_020fcbbe-c1c7-11e3-83fe-001a4bcf887a.html|title=MOVIE BLOG: Review – 'Rio 2'|first=Samantha|last=Madison|work=The Sentinel Cumberlink|date=April 11, 2014|accessdate=April 13, 2014}} It was directed by Todd Wilderman, and features a score composed by [[Lorne Balfe]].{{cite web|title=DreamWorks Animation’s ‘Almost Home’ Features Music by Lorne Balfe|url=http://filmmusicreporter.com/2014/03/11/dreamworks-animations-almost-home-features-music-by-lorne-balfe/|publisher=Film Music Reporter|accessdate=March 15, 2014|date=March 11, 2014}} The short shows The Boov and their leader Captain Smek in a sequence of unsuccessful attempts at finding a hospitable planet, before they finally come across the Earth.{{cite web|last=Wieselman|first=Jarett|title=Meet The Alien Stars Of DreamWorks Animation’s New Movie "Home"|url=https://www.buzzfeed.com/jarettwieselman/home-exclusive-introduction-video|publisher=BuzzFeed|accessdate=March 10, 2014|date=March 10, 2014}} The film itself premiered at the [[Boulder International Film Festival]] on March 7, 2015.{{cite web|url=http://www.biff1.com/2015/03/reald-3d-comes-to-boulder-theater/ |title=RealD 3D Comes to Boulder Theater |publisher=Biff1.com |date=March 7, 2015 |accessdate=March 25, 2015}} ===Home media=== ''Home'' was released digitally on June 26, 2015,{{cite web|title=Home|url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/movie/home/id970125198|publisher=iTunes|accessdate=May 17, 2015}}{{cite web|title=Home|url=https://www.amazon.com/Home-Jim-Parsons/dp/B00V9U6BP8|publisher=Amazon.com|accessdate=May 17, 2015}} and was released on [[DVD]], [[Blu-ray]] and [[Blu-ray#Blu-ray 3D|Blu-ray 3D]] on July 28, 2015.{{cite web|url=http://www.blu-ray.com/news/?id=16768 |title=Home Blu-ray |publisher=Blu-ray.com |date= |accessdate=May 16, 2015}} In the United Kingdom, ''Home'' went to number one on the Official Video Chart in its first week of sale.{{cite web|title=Rihanna's Home DVD outselling the rest of the Top 10 on Official Video Chart|url=http://www.officialcharts.com/chart-news/home-dvd-outselling-the-rest-of-the-top-10-on-official-video-chart-update__10138/|publisher=Official Charts|accessdate=August 4, 2015}} ==Reception== ===Box office=== ''Home'' grossed $177.4 million in North America and has grossed $208.6 million in other territories for a worldwide total of $386 million. Its production cost was $135 million, with a similar sum spent for prints and advertising (P&A).{{cite news|last1=Rainey|first1=James|title=DreamWorks Animation Earnings Beat Q1 Projections Narrowly|url=https://variety.com/2015/biz/news/dreamworks-animation-earnings-1201485024/|accessdate=May 1, 2015|work=Variety|date=April 30, 2015}} ''[[Deadline Hollywood]]'' calculated the net profit of the film to be $29.12 million, when factoring together all expenses and revenues for the film.{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2016/03/home-profit-box-office-2015-1201721660/|title=No. 20 ‘Home’ – 2015 Most Valuable Movie Blockbuster Tournament|author=Mike Fleming Jr|website=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|date=March 18, 2016|accessdate=March 19, 2016}} ''Home'' opened in the U.S. and Canada simultaneously with the comedy ''[[Get Hard]]'' on March 27, 2015. Though the latter earned higher in its Thursday late-night run, estimates were showing that ''Home'' was heading to No. 1 in its opening weekend.{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2015/03/get-hard-kevin-hart-will-ferrell-box-office-1201399851/|title=‘Get Hard’ Grabs $1.8M Thursday, Beats Preview B.O. For Kevin Hart’s ‘Ride Along’|author=Anthony D'Alessandro|website=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|date=March 27, 2015|accessdate=March 28, 2015}}{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/box-office-home-soars-friday-784869|title=Box Office: 'Home' Soars Friday for $50M-Plus Debut|author=Pamela McClintock|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|date=March 27, 2015|accessdate=March 28, 2015}}{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2015/film/news/home-box-office-get-hard-box-office-1201461676/|title=Box Office: ‘Home’ Heading Over Forecasts for $44 Million Opening; ‘Get Hard’ Looking at $38 Million|author=Dave McNarry|publisher=''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]''|date=March 27, 2015|accessdate=March 28, 2015}}{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2015/03/home-get-hard-will-ferrell-kevin-hart-weekend-box-office-1201400112/|title=DWA Poised For A 'Home' Run With $53M Weekend; 'Get Hard' Gets Rich With $33M|author=Anthony D'Alessandro|website=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|date=March 28, 2015|accessdate=March 28, 2015}}{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2015/film/box-office/box-office-home-blasts-off-for-massive-59-million-weekend-1201462056/|title=Box Office: ‘Home’ Blasts Off for Massive $59 Million Weekend|author=Maane Khatchatourian|publisher=''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]''|date=March 28, 2015|accessdate=March 28, 2015}} It scored one of the biggest opening days for a DreamWorks Animation non-sequel ever with $15.6 million, behind ''[[Kung Fu Panda]]'' ($20 million) and ''[[Monsters vs. Aliens]]'' ($16.75 million).{{cite web|url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/news/?id=4050&p=.htm|title=Friday Report: DreamWorks Animation's 'Home' Rules with $15.6 Million|author=Ray Subers|publisher=''[[Box Office Mojo]]''|date=March 28, 2015|accessdate=March 28, 2015}}{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/scottmendelson/2015/03/28/box-office-rihanna-jlo-power-dreamworks-home-to-15-6m-friday/|title=Box Office: Rihanna, JLo Power DreamWorks 'Home' To $15.6M Friday|author=Scott Mendelson|publisher=''[[Forbes]]''|date=March 28, 2015|accessdate=March 29, 2015}} ''Home'' debuted at the top of the box office, with $52.1 million, which exceeded predictions of a $30 million to $35 million opening and was also DreamWorks Animation's best opening since the $60.3 million debut of ''[[Madagascar 3: Europe's Most Wanted]]''.{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2015/film/news/box-office-home-trumps-expectations-with-54-million-debut-1201462181/|title=Box Office: ‘Home’ Trumps Expectations With $54 Million Debut|author=Brent Lang|publisher=''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]''|date=March 29, 2015|accessdate=March 29, 2015}}{{cite web|url=http://boxofficemojo.com/news/?id=4051&p=.htm|title=Weekend Report: Moviegoers Go 'Home,' 'Get Hard'|author=Ray Subers|publisher=''[[Box Office Mojo]]''|date=March 29, 2015|accessdate=March 29, 2015}} Outside North America, ''Home'' was released in 10 countries on March 20, 2015, a week ahead of its U.S. premiere. It earned $20.1 million, coming in third place at the international box office behind ''[[Cinderella (2015 Disney film)|Cinderella]]'' and ''[[The Divergent Series: Insurgent]]''.{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2015/03/international-box-office-insurgent-home-gunman-cinderella-kingsman-1201396540/|title=‘Insurgent’ Tops Overseas Box Office; DWA’s ‘Home’ Runs Up $20M – Update|author=Nancy Tartaglione|website=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|date=March 22, 2015|accessdate=March 23, 2015}} The following weekend, it expanded to 55 additional countries and grossed a total of $24 million from 11,250 screens in 64 countries.{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2015/03/cinderella-leads-international-weekend-box-office-kingsman-china-home-get-hard-1201400720/|title=‘Cinderella’ Takes International Box Office Crown; ‘Home’ Rounds $48M After 2 Frames|author=Nancy Tartaglione|website=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|date=March 29, 2015|accessdate=March 30, 2015}} Its largest openings occurred in the UK, Ireland and Malta ($9.12 million), Russia ($5.17 million), Mexico ($3 million), Brazil ($2.3 million),{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2015/04/international-box-office-furious-7-china-record-longest-ride-insurgent-paul-blart-1201408563/|title=‘Furious 7′ Box Office Hits $801.5M Global; ‘Paul Blart 2′, ‘Longest Ride’ New Overseas |author=Nancy Tartaglione|website=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|date=April 13, 2015|accessdate=April 14, 2015}} Australia ($2.42 million), and Spain ($2.24 million). ===Critical response=== On [[review aggregator]] website [[Rotten Tomatoes]], the film has a rating of 49%, based on 120 reviews, with an [[Weighted arithmetic mean|average rating]] of 5.3/10. The site's consensus reads, "Colorful, silly, and utterly benign, ''Home'' is a passable diversion, but there's no shortage of superior animated alternatives."{{cite web|url=http://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/home_2015/ |title=Home |publisher=Rotten Tomatoes |accessdate=June 1, 2015}} On [[Metacritic]], which assigns a normalized rating, the film has a score of 55 out of 100, based on 31 critics, indicating "mixed or average reviews".{{cite web|url=http://www.metacritic.com/movie/home-2015|title=Home Reviews|work=[[Metacritic]]|publisher=[[CBS Interactive]]|accessdate=April 1, 2015}} In [[CinemaScore]] polls conducted during the opening weekend, cinema audiences gave ''Home'' an average grade of "A" on an A+ to F scale.{{cite web | url=http://www.cinemascore.com/ | title=CinemaScore | work=cinemascore.com | accessdate=March 28, 2015}} Michael Rechtshaffen of ''[[The Hollywood Reporter]]'' said, "There may be no place like home, but there are a lot of places like ''Home'', an animated adventure about the unlikely friendship between a lonely girl and an alien misfit that can't help but feel familiar."{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movie/happy-smekday/review/779961|title='Home': Film Review|author=Michael Rechtshaffen|work=The Hollywood Reporter|accessdate=March 28, 2015}} James Rocchi of ''[[The Wrap]]'' gave the film a positive review, saying "As animated sci-fi for small fry, it's a success whose modest but well-executed ambitions are no small part of its charm."{{cite web|url=http://www.thewrap.com/home-jim-parsons-rhianna-steve-martin-jennifer-lopez/|title='Home' Review: Jim Parsons and Rihanna Team Up for Small Fry Sci-Fi|work=TheWrap|accessdate=March 28, 2015}} Stephen Whitty gave the film two out of five stars, saying "The Gummi-colored animation is imaginative, but director Tim Johnson's ho-hum 3D cartoon remains strictly 1D."{{cite web|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/movies/home-review-dreamworks-aliens-invade-earth-article-1.2161934 |title='Home' review: DreamWorks' aliens invade Earth |publisher=NY Daily News |date=March 23, 2015 |accessdate=March 28, 2015}} Rafer Guzman of ''[[Newsday]]'' gave the film two out of four stars, saying "The film moves quickly and keeps the jokes coming, which only means that ''Home'' would rather keep young viewers occupied than give them something to think about."{{cite web|url=http://www.newsday.com/entertainment/movies/home-review-novel-turned-comedy-1.10115495|title='Home' review: Novel turned comedy|work=Newsday|accessdate=March 28, 2015}} Ben Sachs of the ''[[Chicago Reader]]'' gave the film a negative review, saying "Aggressive and cynical approach to children's entertainment, pummeling viewers with mechanical-looking action sequences (which suggest video game demos), unfunny one-liners, and overly loud pop songs and sound effects."{{cite web|url=http://www.chicagoreader.com/chicago/home/MovieTimes?oid=16852271|title=Home|work=Chicago Reader|accessdate=March 28, 2015}} Claudia Puig of ''[[USA Today]]'' gave the film two out of five stars, saying "Key characters are admirably diverse, but the fast-paced tale is thoroughly predictable."{{cite web|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/life/movies/2015/03/26/home-review/25118615/|title='Home' looks friendly, but all too familiar|author=Claudia Puig, USA TODAY|date=March 26, 2015|work=USA TODAY|accessdate=March 28, 2015}} Soren Anderson of ''[[The Seattle Times]]'' gave the film two and a half stars out of four, saying "It works moderately well thanks largely to the voice talents of Jim Parsons and, to a lesser extent, Steve Martin. Two droll dudes who put a fair share of funny into this animated picture."{{cite web|url=http://www.seattletimes.com/entertainment/home-a-close-encounter-with-colorful-aliens/|title=‘Home’: a close encounter with colorful aliens|work=The Seattle Times|accessdate=March 28, 2015}} Neil Genzlinger of ''[[The New York Times]]'' called the film "A charming concoction with positive messages for younger children about conquering fears, understanding outsiders and knowing yourself."{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2015/03/27/movies/review-home-with-rihanna-and-jim-parsons.html?partner=rss&emc=rss&_r=0|title=Review: ‘Home,’ With Rihanna and Jim Parsons|author=Neil Genzlinger|work=The New York Times|accessdate=March 28, 2015}} Betsy Sharkey of the ''[[Los Angeles Times]]'' gave the film a negative review, saying "Tension is one of Home's biggest issues. There just isn't nearly enough of it. Story is another. Even a kids' movie needs more complexity and more invention."{{cite web|url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/movies/la-et-mn-home-review-20150327-column.html|title=Review: Quirky 'Home,' with Jim Parsons and Rihanna, keeps it too light - LA Times|author=Los Angeles Times|date=March 26, 2015|work=latimes.com|accessdate=March 28, 2015}} Linda Barnard of the ''[[Toronto Star]]'' gave the film two and a half stars out of four, saying "Aside from Parsons' initially amusingly mangled Yoda-like English, which gets a tad repetitive, ''Home'' doesn't stand out as fresh or particularly funny."{{cite web|url=https://www.thestar.com/entertainment/movies/2015/03/26/home-is-where-the-boov-is-movie-review.html|title=Home is where the Boov is: movie review|date=March 26, 2015|work=thestar.com|accessdate=March 28, 2015}} Dana Rose Falcone of ''[[Entertainment Weekly]]'' gave the film an A-, saying "The combination of ''Home'''s layered message, fun score, and clever comedy make it a colorful choice for moviegoers of any age."{{cite web|url=http://www.ew.com/article/2015/03/27/home-ew-review|title='Home': EW review|work=Entertainment Weekly's EW.com|accessdate=March 28, 2015}} Stephanie Zacharek of ''[[The Village Voice]]'' gave the film a mixed review, saying "If director Tim Johnson -- adapting Adam Rex's book ''The True Meaning of Smekday'' -- can't do much with the story's confused, if well-intentioned, agenda, at least he's got some charming, vivid characters to work with."{{cite web|url=http://www.villagevoice.com/movies/home-3712091/|title=New York : Home|date=September 12, 2012|work=villagevoice.com|accessdate=March 28, 2015}} [[Richard Roeper]] of the ''[[Chicago Sun-Times]]'' gave the film a C, saying "Anyone over 10 will see the plot twists a mile away. Kids will probably enjoy the goofy Boovs, the rainbows of colors and the music. Call me a traditionalist, but I still say the world was a better place before those darn Boovs invaded."{{cite web|url=http://www.richardroeper.com/reviews/w/home.aspx|title=Home - RichardRoeper.com|work=richardroeper.com|accessdate=March 28, 2015|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150402015951/http://www.richardroeper.com/reviews/w/home.aspx|archivedate=April 2, 2015|df=mdy-all}} Peter Debruge of ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'' gave the film a negative review, saying "From a creative standpoint, this is the studio's least exciting feature yet - hardly its worst, execution-wise, but entirely lacking in the risk-taking spirit that has spawned such successful franchises as ''Shrek'', ''Kung Fu Panda'' and ''Dragon''."{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2015/film/reviews/film-review-home-1201448174/|title=‘Home’ Review: DreamWorks’ Alien-Invasion Comedy Barely Gets on Base - Variety|author=Peter Debruge|work=Variety|accessdate=March 28, 2015}} Sara Stewart of the ''[[New York Post]]'' gave the film two out of five stars, saying "It's refreshing to see a nonwhite lead, and the husky-voiced pop singer is likable as a brave-hearted kid searching for her mother. But man, is there a lot of Rihanna in this movie: She also provides what seems like the entirety of the film's soundtrack, making it feel like a vanity project (is 'vanimation' a thing?)."{{cite web|url=https://nypost.com/2015/03/25/rihanna-jim-parsons-space-out-in-cliche-animated-flick-home/|title=Rihanna, Jim Parsons space out in cliché animated flick ‘Home’|work=New York Post|accessdate=March 28, 2015}} Barbara VanDenburgh of ''[[The Arizona Republic]]'' gave the film two out of five stars, saying "For all its energy, razzle-dazzle and whiz-bang technology, it doesn't know how to tell a simple story or cobble together three-dimensional characters, and that's a problem not even the best of 3-D glasses can fix."{{cite web|url=http://www.azcentral.com/story/entertainment/movies/2015/03/26/review-dreamworks-home-neither-sweet-dreamy/70448090/|title=Review: 'Home' is slick but neither sweet nor dreamy|date=March 26, 2015|work=azcentral|accessdate=March 28, 2015}} Susan Wloszczyna of [[RogerEbert.com]] gave the film two out of four stars, saying "I kept thinking about ''[[Lilo & Stitch]]'' while watching ''Home'', a decidedly disappointing effort based on the popular kid-lit book ''The True Meaning of Smekday'' from the already embattled folks at DreamWorks Animation."{{cite web|url=http://www.rogerebert.com/reviews/home-2015|title=Home|author=Susan Wloszczyna|date=March 27, 2015|work=rogerebert.com|accessdate=March 28, 2015}} ===Accolades=== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="width:100%;" |- style="background:#ccc; text-align:center;" ! colspan="4" style="background: LightSteelBlue;" | Awards |- style="background:#ccc; text-align:center;" ! Award !! Category !! Winner/Nominee !! Result |- | rowspan="3" |[[43rd Annie Awards|Annie Awards]] | Outstanding Achievement, Animated Effects in an Animated Production | Greg Gladstone, Tim Hoff, Mark Newport, Jason Rickwald, Stephen Wood | {{nom}} |- | Outstanding Achievement, Character Animation in a Feature Production | Mark Donald | {{nom}} |- | Outstanding Achievement, Production Design in an Animated Feature Production | Emil Mitev | {{nom}} |- | [[Black Reel Awards of 2016|Black Reel Awards]] | [[Black Reel Award for Best Voice Performance|Best Voice Performance]] | Rihanna | {{won}} |- | rowspan="3" |[[2016 Kids' Choice Awards|Kids' Choice Awards]] | Favorite Animated Movie | ''Home'' | {{nom}} |- | rowspan="2" | Favorite Voice From an Animated Movie | Jennifer Lopez | {{nom}} |- | Jim Parsons | {{nom}} |- | rowspan="2" |[[42nd People's Choice Awards|People's Choice Awards]] | Favorite Animated Movie Voice | Rihanna | {{nom}} |- | Favorite Family Movie | ''Home'' | {{nom}} |- | [[Visual Effects Society Awards 2015|Visual Effects Society Awards]] | Outstanding Effects Simulations in an Animated Feature | Greg Gladstone, Michael Losure, Chris De St Jeor, Alex Timchenkio | {{nom}} |} ==Television series== An animated series titled ''[[Home: Adventures with Tip & Oh]]'' was released on [[Netflix]] on July 29, 2016.{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2016/03/dreamworks-animation-sets-july-debut-for-new-netflix-series-home-adventures-with-tip-oh-1201729478/|title=DreamWorks Animation’ ‘Home: Adventures With Tip & Oh’ Bows On Netflix In Summer - Deadline|author=Ross A. Lincoln|website=Deadline Hollywood}} [[Rihanna]] and [[Jim Parsons]] do not reprise their roles as Tip and Oh; they are instead voiced by [[Rachel Crow]] and Mark Whitten, respectively (although [[Matt Jones (actor)|Matt Jones]] reprises his role of Kyle from the film). It was developed by [[Thurop Van Orman]] and Ryan Crego. ==See also== *[[List of animated feature films of 2015]] *''[[The True Meaning of Smekday]],'' the book that the film is based on. ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *{{Official website|http://www.dreamworksanimation.com/home/}} at DreamWorks Animation *{{IMDb title|2224026}} *{{bcdb title|144846|Home}} *{{mojo title|happysmekday|Home}} *{{rotten-tomatoes|home_2015|Home}} *{{metacritic film|home-2015|Home}} {{DreamWorks animated films}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Home}} [[Category:2015 films]] [[Category:English-language films]] [[Category:2015 3D films]] [[Category:2015 computer-animated films]] [[Category:2010s American animated films]] [[Category:2010s comedy science fiction films]] [[Category:20th Century Fox animated films]] [[Category:20th Century Fox films]] [[Category:American 3D films]] [[Category:American buddy films]] [[Category:American children's animated comedy films]] [[Category:American comedy science fiction films]] [[Category:American computer-animated films]] [[Category:American films]] [[Category:Animated buddy films]] [[Category:Animated films based on children's books]] [[Category:Animated films based on novels]] [[Category:DreamWorks Animation animated films]] [[Category:Films about extraterrestrial life]] [[Category:Films featuring anthropomorphic characters]] [[Category:Films based on American novels]] [[Category:Films directed by Tim Johnson]] [[Category:Films set in Australia]] [[Category:Films set in Paris]] [[Category:Films set in the United States]] [[Category:Films scored by Lorne Balfe]]

{{Orphan|date=April 2014}}
{{Infobox film | italic title = no | name = iThemba | image = | caption = Film poster | director = [[Elinor Burkett]] | producers = Elinor Burkett and Errol Webber | music = Liyana | cinematography = Errol Webber | editing = Errol Webber | released = {{Film date|2010|11|18|[[International Documentary Film Festival Amsterdam|Amsterdam]]}} | runtime = 72 minutes | country = Zimbabwe | language = English }}{{DISPLAYTITLE:''iThemba''}} '''''iThemba''''' is a feature-length documentary film shot in [[Zimbabwe]], directed and produced by [[Elinor Burkett]] and produced by Errol Webber, who also shot and edited the film. It premiered at the [[International Documentary Film Festival Amsterdam]] in November 2010.<ref>http://www.idfa.nl/industry/Festival/films-2010.aspx?partID=591027B9-0968-4506-88AD-7F01B80F64EA/</ref>
The film follows the members of the Zimbabwean band Liyana, a group of eight musicians with physical disabilities who navigate a country where many of their neighbors consider them to be cursed.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kinggeorge6.org// |title=KGVI |publisher=Kinggeorge6.org |date= |accessdate=2012-05-15}}</ref> The funny and talented young people take viewers with them as they travel across the city of [[Bulawayo]] and into remote villages, to rural bottle shops and urban marketplaces, inside the huts of traditional healers and the neighborhoods of the urban poor – into an Africa rarely seen by outsiders, a place where tradition is not necessarily gentle, where it threatens to trap the unfortunate, and where a few fight back.
Meet Marvelous Mbulo, the lady-killing lead singer, whose wit provides the film's heart. Listen to Prudence Mabhena, Liyana's musical heart. And travel Zimbabwe with the wise-cracking Energy Maburutse, whose humor belies the seriousness of his situation.
The film is filled with an endless flow of the band’s jokes and satire and their amazing Afro-fusion melodies, most composed by members of Liyana.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://sites.google.com/site/liyanakg6/ |title=liyanakg6 |publisher=Sites.google.com |date= |accessdate=2012-05-15}}</ref>
Shot during and in the wake of the [[Zimbabwean presidential election, 2008]] and the country’s economic meltdown by an American, Zimbabwean and Jamaican team, the film unfolds against the backdrop of enormous political tension and the daily struggle to find a bank that actually had cash, to buy food although the store shelves were empty, and to navigate streets pocked with wheelchair-mangling potholes.<ref>{{cite news| url=https://www.nytimes.com/2006/05/02/world/africa/02zimbabwe.html | work=The New York Times | first=Michael | last=Wines | title=How Bad Is Inflation in Zimbabwe? | date=2006-05-02}}</ref>
==Title== The title of the film means Hope in isiNdebele, one of the two major languages of Zimbabwe. It is drawn from the film’s title song.
==Cast== In alphabetical order ::Farai Mabhande ::Prudence Mabhena ::Marvelous Mbulo ::Energy Maburutse ::Honest Mupatsi ::Tapiwa Nyengera ::Goodwell Nzou ::Vusani Vuma
==See also== *''[[Music by Prudence]]'', a documentary film about Prudence Mabhena
== References == <!--- See [[Wikipedia:Footnotes]] on how to create references using <ref></ref> tags which will then appear here automatically --> {{Reflist}} http://www.kinggeorge6.org http://sites.google.com/site/liyanakg6 https://www.nytimes.com/2006/05/02/world/africa/02zimbabwe.html
== External links == * {{IMDb title|1541006|iThemba}} * {{Official website|http://www.loliandrex.com}} * [http://www.kinggeorge6.org King George VI Centre and School for Children with Physical Disabilities] * [http://sites.google.com/site/liyanakg6 Liyana web page]
